model

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • model.Clock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IPublisher

    public class Clock
extends java.util.TimerTask
implements IPublisher
    A Clock instance is a free-running asynchronous timer. It conforms to the IPublisher interface.
    Author:
    jeff

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clock() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      This method is called automatically by the timer at each clock tick.
      void setDelay(long delay)
      Sets the delay of this clock.
      void start()
      Starts the clock running for an unbounded number of ticks.
      void start(int numTicks)
      Starts the clock running for a specific number of ticks.
      void stop()
      Stops a running clock.
      void subscribe(ISubscriber subscriber)
      Adds a subscriber to the list of subscribers for this clock.
      void tick()
      This method is called by the run() method.
      void unsubscribe(ISubscriber subscriber)
      Removes a subscriber from the list of subscribers for this clock.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clock

        public Clock()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is called automatically by the timer at each clock tick. If you're thinking about calling this method, don't. Call tick() instead. (Yes, it's like having two doorways that lead into the same room. This doorway is not for you.)
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(long delay)
        Sets the delay of this clock. By default, the clock is set to tick once every 500 mS (which is every 1/2 second).
        Parameters:
        delay - The number of milliseconds to delay between ticks.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the clock running for an unbounded number of ticks. To stop the clock, call the stop() method.

      • start

        public void start(int numTicks)
        Starts the clock running for a specific number of ticks.
        Parameters:
        numTicks -

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops a running clock.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(ISubscriber subscriber)
        Adds a subscriber to the list of subscribers for this clock. Each time the clock ticks, all subscribers will be notified of the clock tick.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface IPublisher
        Parameters:
        subscriber -

      • tick

        public void tick()
        This method is called by the run() method. You may call this method to test or simulate a single clock tick.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(ISubscriber subscriber)
        Removes a subscriber from the list of subscribers for this clock.
        Specified by:
        unsubscribe in interface IPublisher
        Parameters:
        subscriber -
